DataElement.preferredName: Limb Available Vascular Volume Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value representing the available vascular space within a single limb of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service._Relating to or containing blood vessels._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: body part, which consists of a maximal set of diverse subclasses of organ and organ part spatially associated with a complete set of bones of the appendicular skeleton, it is partially surrounded by skin of limb. Examples: There are only four instances, right upper and lower limbs and left upper and lower limbs.

Concepts.definition: body part, which consists of a maximal set of diverse subclasses of organ and organ part spatially associated with a complete set of bones of the appendicular skeleton, it is partially surrounded by skin of limb. Examples: There are only four instances, right upper and lower limbs and left upper and lower limbs.

Property.preferredDefinition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.:Relating to or containing blood vessels.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
Relating to or containing blood vessels.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed._The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.:The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University melanoma clinical trial
